common_issues.title: PiecesOS Account Linking and Startup Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with linking multiple accounts (Google, GitHub) and PiecesOS failing to launch on macOS and Windows due to dependency errors.  Suggested solutions include waiting for new authentication service, updating to the latest version (11.1.1), and contacting Pieces support for individual troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* The current account linking flow is not functioning properly.
* Several similar issues have been reported.
* User is experiencing difficulty linking their Github account to their Pieces account.

**Problems Identified:**

* Account linking flow is outdated and not straightforward.
* Potential issue with email case sensitivity.
* Existing bugs in the authentication process.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **By Pieces Support:**
    * Offered to resolve the issue through a call or email.
    * Provided suggestions for account linking and merging.
    * Suggested a solution based on the new authentication service.
    * Reset the user's Github user account.
    * Temporarily disabled email privacy on the user's Github account.
    * Advised the user to wait for the new authentication service.
* **By User:**
    * Suggested waiting for the new authentication service to be implemented.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is currently unresolved.
* The user is waiting for the new authentication service to be released.
* Pieces Support is confident that the new authentication service will resolve the issue.

**Additional Notes:**

* The new authentication service is expected to be ready by the end of February 2025.
* It is unclear if existing data will be migrated to the new authentication service.


**Overall, this conversation highlights the challenges associated with the current account linking process. The implementation of the new authentication service is expected to resolve these issues and streamline the user experience.**

PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* **Multiple users reported issues with PiecesOS failing to launch, including being stuck on the "dependencies scenario" tab and not appearing in the system tray.**
* **The issue appears to be affecting both Windows and macOS users.**
* **The issue was exacerbated by a major data migration that PiecesOS was undergoing.**

**Solutions Proposed and Implemented:**

* **Pieces team identified the issue and escalated its severity.**
* **Pieces team offered to hop on calls with users to troubleshoot the issue.**
* **Pieces team recommended users try their appInstaller build instead of the exe installer.**
* **Pieces team released a new build (11.1.1) that resolved the issue for most users.**

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* **The issue appears to be resolved for most users with the release of version 11.1.1.**
* **Some users may still be experiencing issues and are encouraged to follow up with the Pieces team.**

## Additional Notes:

* This summary focused on the most important details of the conversation.
* The conversation included some irrelevant information, such as Shamas-Habib's experience with Atlas OS.
* Some users, such as JasonDWilson, reported the issue persisting even after updating to version 11.1.1. They have scheduled calls with the Pieces team for further troubleshooting. 

## Conclusion:

The Pieces team has identified and resolved the issue that was causing PiecesOS to fail to launch. However, some users may still be experiencing issues and are encouraged to follow up with the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* The issue is related to ollama failing to install in Pieces-OS when installed as a snap on Ubuntu.
* The root cause is that ollama relies on `curl`, which is not available in the snap's sandboxed environment.
* This affects both inference and downloading of local llm models.

**Problems Identified:**

* Ollama installation fails within the Pieces-OS snap environment due to missing `curl`.
* This prevents both downloading and using local llm models.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Patching Pieces-OS to allow access to `curl` from the sandbox environment.
* Allowing Pieces-OS to use ollama from within its sandbox.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* As of January 23, 2025, the issue is still present in the snap version of Pieces-OS.
* A fix is currently being worked on and expected to be released within the next week (January 28 - February 3).
* No workaround is currently available for downloading or using local llm models.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue is causing frustration among users who prefer not to use cloud-based LLMs and want to leverage the privacy benefits of local models.
* The Pieces-OS team is aware of the inconvenience and actively working on a resolution.
